citeinfo.origin: Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority
citeinfo.title: Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Boundary

descript.abstract: Derived from the Amalgamated Great Barrier Reef (AGBR) Section that replaces all previously existing sections.The AGBR was proclaimed under subsection 31 (1) of the Act in 2003 (Gazette No S119) dated 21 April 2004.

idinfo.accconst: The Data is subject to Copyright. Usage must comply with signed data usage agreement. Appropriate acknowledgement of the custodian must be created in all outputs. No third party usage is permitted without prior written consent of the custodian.

cntorgp.cntorg: Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority

idinfo.useconst: Completion of GBRMPA Digital Data Agreement
idinfo.datacred: The Data is subject to Copyright. Products should show acknowledgement in the form of "Data courtesy of the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority".

dataqual.logic: Boundary coincides with GBRMP ZONING, and COAST2007.
dataqual.complete: The gazetted/current Great Barrier Reef Marine Park is represented.

horizpa.horizpar: 1 metre for Marine Boundary; +/- 70 metres for Coastal Boundary as per nominal scale, as it relies partly on locational accuracy of other base GBRMPA datasets, namely ZONING, COAST2007.

procstep.procdesc: Manareas derived from GBRMP boundary dataset edits, to effect the removal of new Coastal Sections and encompass updates to coastal feature extents.Derived from gazetted descriptions, and in part from references to datasets produced by the Division of National Mapping, RAN Hydrographic Service. The marine park boundaries were updated March 2002 to redefine the major boundaries according to their Geodesic descriptions. This was done by applying a routine to reposition 5km lengths of the boundary lines.The Amalgamated Great Barrier Reef Section (the AGBR Section) was proclaimed under subsection 31 (1) of the Act in 2003 (Gazette No. s119 dated 21 April 2004).The AGBR Section covers more than 99% of the Great Barrier Reef Region and replaces all previously existing Sections. For administrative purposes, the AGBR Section is divided into 4 management areas:· the Far Northern Management Area· the Cairns/Cooktown Management Area· the Townsville/Whitsunday Management Area· the Mackay/Capricorn Management Area.Although these management areas have no legislative effect, they approximate the areas of the previous 4 main Sections and provide a basis for the regional management of the Marine Park. Further sub-areas or regions may also be identified for particular management purposes.A number of edits were made to manareas on the 31/07/2006 to reflect new State Marine Park boundaries. In particular, cutbacks to manareas occurred at Broadsound, Congulla, Shoalwater Bay, Port Lucinda, Orient Creek, Bohle River, Alligator Creek, Crocodile Creek, Cocoa Creek, Barramundi Creek, Barratta Creek, Seaforth and Cape Capricorn.
Boundary redrawn (Dec 2007) to improve accuracy where coincident with coastline (derived from COAST2007), in particular island coastlines in the Whitsunday and Cairns regions.

report.measDesc: Boundary coincides with GBRMP ZONING, and COAST2007.
The gazetted/current Great Barrier Reef Marine Park is represented.
1 metre for Marine Boundary; +/- 70 metres for Coastal Boundary as per nominal scale, as it relies partly on locational accuracy of other base GBRMPA datasets, namely ZONING, COAST2007.

prcStep.stepDesc:
Manareas derived from GBRMP boundary dataset edits, to effect the removal of new Coastal Sections and encompass updates to coastal feature extents. Derived from gazetted descriptions, and in part from references to datasets produced by the Division of National Mapping, RAN Hydrographic Service. The marine park boundaries were updated March 2002 to redefine the major boundaries according to their Geodesic descriptions. This was done by applying a routine to reposition 5km lengths of the boundary lines. The Amalgamated Great Barrier Reef Section (the AGBR Section) was proclaimed under subsection 31 (1) of the Act in 2003 (Gazette No. s119 dated 21 April 2004). The AGBR Section covers more than 99% of the Great Barrier Reef Region and replaces all previously existing Sections.
For administrative purposes, the AGBR Section is divided into 4 management areas:· the Far Northern Management Area· the Cairns/Cooktown Management Area· the Townsville/Whitsunday Management Area· the Mackay/Capricorn Management Area. Although these management areas have no legislative effect, they approximate the areas of the previous 4 main Sections and provide a basis for the regional management of the Marine Park. Further sub-areas or regions may also be identified for particular management purposes. A number of edits were made to manareas on the 31/07/2006 to reflect new State Marine Park boundaries. In particular, cutbacks to manareas occurred at Broadsound, Congulla, Shoalwater Bay, Port Lucinda, Orient Creek, Bohle River, Alligator Creek, Crocodile Creek, Cocoa Creek, Barramundi Creek, Barratta Creek, Seaforth and Cape Capricorn.
Boundary redrawn (Dec 2007) to improve accuracy where coincident with coastline (derived from COAST2007), in particular island coastlines in the Whitsunday and Cairns regions.
